bioghist.p: Lafayette Cemetery was a non-sectarian cemetery originally located at 10th and Wharton Street in Philadelphia. It was incorporated in 1838. In 1946, all of the remains were removed to Evergreen Memorial Park, near Langhorne in Bucks County, Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: The collection is comprised of a ledger listing annual assessments for people with plots in the cemetery, 1909-1927. Entries include name, address, burial plot, and amount and notation of payment of annual assessments. Additional papers in the volume include miscellaneous annual and financial reports, receipts and documents related to paving around the cemetery, 1907-1930.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
